definition: An Jung-geun or Ahn Joong-keun (1879-1910), Korean independence activist, famous as assassin of Japanese prime minister ITŌ Hirobumi 伊藤博文[Yi1 teng2 Bo2 wen2] in 1909
surname An

sentences.english: What is the Chinese Government's official position on Ahn Joong-keun?
sentences.chinese: 请问中国政府现在对于安重根义士的正式立场是什么？

definition: ITŌ Hirobumi (1841-1909), Japanese Meiji restoration politician, prime minister on four occasions, influential in Japanese expansionism in Korea, assassinated in Harbin
Song Jiaoren (1882-1913), politician of the revolutionary party involved in the 1911 Xinhai revolution, murdered in Shanghai in 1913
Tojo Hideki (1884-1948), Japanese military leader hanged as war criminal in 1948
Wang Ching-wei (1883-1944), left-wing Guomingdang politician, subsequently Japanese collaborator
the Mukden or Manchurian Railway Incident of 18th September 1931 used by the Japanese as a pretext to annex Manchuria/also known as Liutiaogou incident 柳條溝事變|柳条沟事变
the war of 1904-1905 between Russia and Japan
Xiong Chengji (1887-1910), anti-Qing revolutionary and martyr
Chun Doo Hwan (1931-), South Korean politician, president 1980-1988
Hirohito, personal name of the Shōwa 昭和[Zhao1 he2] emperor of Japan (1901-1989), reigned 1925-1989
Park Chung-Hee (1917-1979), South Korean military man and dictator, president 1963-1979, influential in developing Korean industry, murdered by his bodyguard
Zhang Zuolin (c. 1873-1928), warlord of Manchuria 1916-1928
Chen Tianhua (1875-1905), anti-Qing revolutionary from Hunan, drowned himself in Japan in 1905
Li Dazhao (1889-1927), early Chinese Marxist and founding member of the communist party
Prince KONOE Fumimaro (1891-), Japanese nobleman and militarist politician, prime minister 1937-1939 and 1940-1941
Japanese person or people
First Sino-Japanese War (1894-95)
